intro: Pentacalia involuta, commonly known as the curled pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spirally twisted leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its unique morphology, it is a subject of interest in botanical studies and horticulture.
